content:
Admittedly I believe this is something we were supposed to have codified already :sweat_smile: as part of the roadmap/charter expectations for the year, but curious what your respective thought processes and guidelines are around membership?

I like the framing the compiler team articulated in https://rust-lang.github.io/rfcs/2689-compiler-team-contributors.html#guide-level-explanation as I feel like it helped capture the ideas behind the vague fuzziness of when it "feels right" or "feels time" for someone to join.
also just to clarify, it's a question about your respective subteams/working groups under dev tools, not just the actual dev tools team
FWIW as part of the chartering work we did build a bunch of common reusable text for this https://github.com/rust-lang/governance/blob/master/common/membership_changes.md
the compiler team stuff is good, it's also somewhat extensive and perhaps more extensive than what smaller teams need
I'm also a fan of the text the library team used in this context, by way of path to membership.
oh yeah i forgot that they came up with more details
that's a good place to look yeah

it's also somewhat extensive and perhaps more extensive than what smaller teams need

definitely, especially with the multiple tiers. i like the tenants or principles they have though which seem to have broader applicability
anyone have a link to the library team text handy? if not i shall go searching
oh also FWIW rustdoc and clippy's approach is basically "if you've made a bunch of contributions we'll ask and start tagging you on PRs for review and if you're okay with that we add you to the team"
over time we've raised the bar a bit but that's mostly in the details
